data.meta_description: Born on 13 January 1864 in Gaffken (now Parusnoye), Prussia (now Russia), Wilhelm Wien was a renowned physicist. He made groundbreaking discoveries in the field of electromagnetism, particularly in the laws governing the radiation of heat. He was affiliated with Würzburg University in Würzburg, Germany and was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1911. Learn more about the life and work of this influential scientist.
